tools.name: fel_validate
tools.description: Validate FEL XML totals (subtotal, VAT 12%, total) and required fields.

tools.name: fel_render
tools.description: Render branded PDF from FEL XML.

tools.name: fel_batch
tools.description: Render a directory of FEL XMLs; outputs manifest.json

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file as text. DEPRECATED: Use read_text_file instead.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: read_text_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system as text. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Use the 'head' parameter to read only the first N lines of a file, or the 'tail' parameter to read only the last N lines of a file. Operates on the file as text regardless of extension. Only works within allowed directories.

tail.description: If provided, returns only the last N lines of the file

head.description: If provided, returns only the first N lines of the file

tools.name: read_media_file
tools.description: Read an image or audio file. Returns the base64 encoded data and MIME type. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory_with_sizes
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path, including sizes. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is useful for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

sortBy.description: Sort entries by name or size

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Subdirectories within these allowed directories are also accessible. Use this to understand which directories and their nested paths are available before trying to access files.

tools.name: create_or_update_file
tools.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in

sha.description: SHA of the file being replaced (required when updating existing files)

tools.name: search_repositories
tools.description: Search for GitHub repositories

perPage.description: Number of results per page (default: 30, max: 100)

tools.name: create_repository
tools.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account

private.description: Whether the repository should be private

tools.name: get_file_contents
tools.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

path.description: Path to the file or directory

tools.name: push_files
tools.description: Push multiple files to a GitHub repository in a single commit

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository

tools.name: create_pull_request
tools.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository

head.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented

base.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into

draft.description: Whether to create the pull request as a draft

maintainer_can_modify.description: Whether maintainers can modify the pull request

tools.name: fork_repository
tools.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization

organization.description: Optional: organization to fork to (defaults to your personal account)

tools.name: create_branch
tools.description: Create a new branch in a GitHub repository

from_branch.description: Optional: source branch to create from (defaults to the repository's default branch)

tools.name: list_commits
tools.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository

tools.name: list_issues
tools.description: List issues in a GitHub repository with filtering options

tools.name: update_issue
tools.description: Update an existing issue in a GitHub repository

tools.name: add_issue_comment
tools.description: Add a comment to an existing issue

tools.name: search_code
tools.description: Search for code across GitHub repositories

tools.name: search_issues
tools.description: Search for issues and pull requests across GitHub repositories

tools.name: search_users
tools.description: Search for users on GitHub

tools.name: get_issue
tools.description: Get details of a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

tools.name: get_pull_request
tools.description: Get details of a specific pull request

tools.name: list_pull_requests
tools.description: List and filter repository pull requests

state.description: State of the pull requests to return

head.description: Filter by head user or head organization and branch name

tools.name: create_pull_request_review
tools.description: Create a review on a pull request

commit_id.description: The SHA of the commit that needs a review

body.description: The body text of the review

path.description: The relative path to the file being commented on

position.description: The position in the diff where you want to add a review comment

path.description: The relative path to the file being commented on

line.description: The line number in the file where you want to add a review comment

comments.description: Comments to post as part of the review (specify either position or line, not both)

tools.name: merge_pull_request
tools.description: Merge a pull request

commit_title.description: Title for the automatic commit message

commit_message.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message

tools.name: get_pull_request_files
tools.description: Get the list of files changed in a pull request

tools.name: get_pull_request_status
tools.description: Get the combined status of all status checks for a pull request

tools.name: update_pull_request_branch
tools.description: Update a pull request branch with the latest changes from the base branch

expected_head_sha.description: The expected SHA of the pull request's HEAD ref

tools.name: get_pull_request_comments
tools.description: Get the review comments on a pull request

tools.name: get_pull_request_reviews
tools.description: Get the reviews on a pull request

tools.name: ow_get_player_summary
tools.description: Get player stats summary (winrate, kda, damage, healing). platform/gamemode optional.

tools.name: ow_get_player_stats
tools.description: Get player career-like stats WITH labels. Requires platform and gamemode. Optional hero.

input: Dame un resumen de las estadísticas del jugador YSE#11202 en Overwatch (plataforma PC), incluyendo winrate, KDA, daño y sanación usando ow_get_player_summary.
output:
## Resumen de estadísticas de YSE#11202 (PC)

**Estadísticas generales:**
- **Partidas jugadas:** 4,263 (2,251 ganadas, 2,012 perdidas)
- **Winrate:** 52.8%
- **KDA:** 3.03
- **Daño total:** 30,755,654 (promedio: 8,431 por partida)
- **Sanación total:** 9,527,277 (promedio: 2,612 por partida)

**Por roles:**
- **Tank:** 51.85% winrate, KDA 3.27
- **Damage:** 53.42% winrate, KDA 3.08  
- **Support:** 53.44% winrate, KDA 2.64

**Héroes más jugados:**
- **Doomfist:** 523 partidas (47.8% winrate)
- **Lucio:** 332 partidas (58.73% winrate) 
- **Junkrat:** 289 partidas (56.06% winrate)
- **Reinhardt:** 229 partidas (60.26% winrate)

El jugador muestra un rendimiento sólido con un winrate positivo general y buenos ratios KDA en todos los roles, destacando especialmente en support y damage.
